description:
Hellsing, a secret organization of the British government, has long been battling supernatural threats to keep the people safe from creatures of the night. The current leader, Integra Wingates Hellsing controls her own personal army to eliminate the undead beings, but even her highly trained soldiers pale in comparison to her most trusted vampire exterminator, a man by the name of Alucard, who is actually a powerful vampire himself. Along with Integra's mysterious butler and Alucard's new vampire minion, Seras Victoria, The Hellsing Organization must face not only regular ghouls and vampires, but a rivaling secret organization from the Vatican, and Millennium, an enigmatic group of madmen spawned by a certain war over 50 years ago...
A bloody battle between monsters is about to begin, the dead are dancing, and all hell is singing...

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Noir
tags.description: Stylized as a cynical crime drama with low-key visuals.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Werewolf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a werewolf.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiranokohta)

Starting his career first as a mangaka's assistant (self-described as "horrible" and "lazy" in said assistant position), and later an H manga artist, he went on to enjoy somewhat limited success with other relatively unknown manga titles such as Angel Dust, Coyote, Gun Mania and Hi-Tension. His first major success came with his manga series Hellsing, which got its start and was subsequently serialized in a monthly manga magazine, Young King OURs, towards the latter half of 1997.

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Official Website](http://www.okenkikaku.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/puku1048) | [Blog](https://o-ken.blog.so-net.ne.jp/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大槻ケンヂ)

Kenji Ootsuki is a Japanese rock musician and Seiun Award winning writer from Tokyo. His musical career began in the late 1970s to early 1980s. He is the vocalist of [Kinniku Shoujo Tai](https://anilist.co/staff/280201), Tokusatsu, Underground Searchlie and Karate Bakabon.
**Hideki Tonokatsu** is a Japanese director, series composer, episode director and storyboard artist.

__Place of Birth:__ Los Angeles, California, USA

An American voice director, script writer, voice actor, and former child actor. He is known for directing and writing many English language anime titles for New Generation Pictures, most notably R.O.D the TV and Hellsing. He is also co-directing BECK: Mongolian Chop Squad with Christopher Bevins for FUNimation. Jaffe has also written many articles and spoken as a guest lecturer at universities and libraries. 

(Source: Wikipedia)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/insight001)

**Hayato Matsuo** is a Japanese arranger, composer, orchestrator and musician. Hayato is a composer, arranger and orchestrator for both the video game industry and the anime industry. He has worked on titles such as Front Mission 3, Final Fantasy XII, the Shenmue Series, and Magic Knight Rayearth. Inspired by his mother, who was a piano teacher, he graduated from the music composition department of Tokyo University of the Arts. While in college, he composed for the band G-Clef, and occasionally stood in for the members of the band. Upon graduating, he went to work under Sugiyama Kouichi, the composer of the popular Dragon Quest video game series, arranging his pieces for Dragon Quest anime shows and soundtracks. In 1991, Hayato began to work as a video game music composer himself, writing the score to Master of Monsters. Over the next few years, he worked as an independent composer on several games and anime series, including Ogre Battle: March of the Black Queen. In 1995, he joined the independent music composition group Imagine. He has continued since then to compose and orchestrate works for over 20 games and anime shows, as well as the television show Kamen Rider 555, and a few pieces a part of original albums.

The band bame is derived from the name of a flower, a water lily, written as a sleeping lotus in Chinese characters.  Suilen's Music is like a lotus flower made of thin glass. As the band name describes, Shakuyaku's voice is graceful and mesmerizing. When she sings in either English or Japanese, the echoes of her voice take you to the Asian-esque journey with her skewed nursery-rhymes.  As a contrast, Maki is an electronic noise wizard. His uniques view of new music styles exceeds the listener's expectations. As he refines the melody Shakuyaku resonates, he adds mechanical noises and gradually takes you to a dark industrial world.

[Profile](http://nbcuni-music.com/maon/profile/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kurosakimaon) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/kurosakimaon) | [Youtube](http://www.youtube.com/user/maongue) 

Maon Kurosaki was a Japanese singer and songwriter signed to NBCUniversal Entertainment Japan. After being discovered while working as a performer in Akihabara, Tokyo, she made her major debut in 2010, performing ending themes to the anime television series Highschool of the Dead. She released her debut album H.O.T.D. in September 2010, which features the ending themes from Highschool of the Dead. Her first two singles were used as ending themes to the anime television series A Certain Magical Index II.

Kurosaki's music is influenced by her love of anime and lolita fashion. Her songs have been featured in various anime series such as Jormungand, Tokyo Ravens, and The Fruit of Grisaia. She has collaborated with artists such as Mami Kawada, Kotoko, and Trustrick for her music releases. She performed twice at Anime Expo 2011 in Los Angeles, California, and is a regular performer at Japanese anime events such as LisAni, Animelo Summer Live, and Animax Musix. She has also appeared at Anime Festival Asia, Bangkok Comic Con, and CharaExpo. From 2011 to 2016, she was singer of the synthpop band [ALTIMA](https://anilist.co/staff/109511/), together with Motsu of the band Move.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/28934362)

Anime Director. He began his career at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) where he would eventually make his directorial debut with [Claymore](https://anilist.co/anime/1818/). He then notably worked as Assistant Director throughout the [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/) adaptation at [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/), and has since continued to serve as Assistant and Episode Director on various projects there.

Affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [Producer](https://anilist.co/staff/155543) or other [Director](https://anilist.co/staff/226420) with the same name._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/romanovh) | [Hatena Blog](https://romanovhiga.hateblo.jp/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/418723) | [note](https://note.com/romanovh/)

Romanov Higa, born Kazuhiro Higa, is one of the leading 3DCG animation artists in Japan. He graduated The University of Electro-Communications in Tokyo, Japan in 1996.

In 1997, his work "ONE DAY, SOME GIRL" won the Grand Prix at the 9th Amateur CG Animation Contest organized by Project Team DoGA. In 1999, he joined video game publisher Namco, but left only a few years later in 2001. He then started working freelance, mostly working on his own original movies. In recent years, his work has mostly been either storyboarding or within the art department of video games, and have notably been working on several titles in the *Pokémon* franchise.

**Non-Anime work:**
~!**Gungrave** (VG: PS2) - Movie Direction, Storyboard, Production (OP, ED, some interludes)
**Galaxy Angel** (VG: Windows, PS2, Xbox) - Movie Production (Beginning scene)
**Gungrave OD** (VG: PS2) - Movie Direction, Storyboard, Production (OP, ED, interludes)
**Princess Holiday ~Korogaru Ringotei Sen'ya Ichiya~** (VG: PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**Tsuki wa Higashi ni Hi wa Nishi ni ~Operation Sanctuary~** (VG: Dreamcast, PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**BALDR FORCE EXE** (VG: Dreamcast) - Direction, Storyboard, Production (Intermission movies)
**BALDR FORCE EXE** (VG: PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**Tenkabito** (VG: PS2) - Storyboard (Interlude movie)
**BALDR BULLET EQUILIBRIUM** (VG: PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**Pokémon Sun & Moon** (VG: 3DS) - Storyboard Design
**Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon** (VG: 3DS) - Storyboard Design, Scenario Movie Graphics
**Pokémon Let's Go, Pikachu! & Let's Go, Eevee!** (VG: Switch) - Storyboard Design, Scenario Movie Graphic Design
**Pokémon Sword & Shield** (VG: Switch) - Movie Graphic Design
**New Pokémon Snap** (VG: Switch) - Movie Direction
**Pokémon Legends: Arceus** (VG: Switch) - Cinematic Design Team!~
